title: 'She should be prosecuted': Trump on Nancy Pelosi and husband’s $500K visa stock trades
content: Donald Trump has called for Nancy Pelosi's prosecution, alleging her husband's stock trades ahead of a DOJ lawsuit against Visa raise ethical concerns. He accused Pelosi of having inside knowledge and tipping off her husband before he sold shares in Visa. A representative for Pelosi denied any wrongdoing.
summary: Donald Trump has called for Nancy Pelosi's prosecution, alleging her husband's stock trades ahead of a DOJ lawsuit against Visa raise ethical concerns. He accused Pelosi of having inside knowledge and tipping off her husband before he sold shares in Visa. A representative for Pelosi denied any wrongdoing.

title: 'Kimberly Guilfoyle floating anti-Kamala story for 25 years. The truth is...'
content: ​"So what if Kamala voiced her fierce opposition all those years ago? If the story is true -- if Kamala did discourage Terence Hallinan from hiring Kimberly–maybe Kamala was just prescient. Maybe Kamala could see back then what it took me 20 years to learn. Kimberly doesn’t believe in anything but Kimberly," Jami wrote explaining that this job-snub story comes back again and again whenever Kimberly needs limelight and relevance.
summary: ​"So what if Kamala voiced her fierce opposition all those years ago? If the story is true -- if Kamala did discourage Terence Hallinan from hiring Kimberly–maybe Kamala was just prescient. Maybe Kamala could see back then what it took me 20 years to learn. Kimberly doesn’t believe in anything but Kimberly," Jami wrote explaining that this job-snub story comes back again and again whenever Kimberly needs limelight and relevance.

title: Florida man kayaking in his living room during Hurricane Helene, video viral
content: Matt Heller of Tampa, Florida, used a kayak to navigate his flooded living room as Hurricane Helene's storm surge rapidly rose to 4 feet. Documented on TikTok, the event highlighted record-breaking surges in Tampa Bay, reaching up to 7 feet in some areas. The hurricane caused extensive damage and left millions without power.
summary: Matt Heller of Tampa, Florida, used a kayak to navigate his flooded living room as Hurricane Helene's storm surge rapidly rose to 4 feet. Documented on TikTok, the event highlighted record-breaking surges in Tampa Bay, reaching up to 7 feet in some areas. The hurricane caused extensive damage and left millions without power.

title: Princess Diana was heartbroken over gossip on Prince Harry's 'biological father'
content: Princess Diana felt heartbroken over rumors claiming her riding instructor James Hewitt as Prince Harry's father. Her hairdresser Richard Dalton clarified that Harry was born before Diana met Hewitt and said that the red hair trait Harry got from the Spencer family. Dalton’s memoir unveils unknown aspects of Diana’s life and her relationship with Hewitt.
summary: Princess Diana felt heartbroken over rumors claiming her riding instructor James Hewitt as Prince Harry's father. Her hairdresser Richard Dalton clarified that Harry was born before Diana met Hewitt and said that the red hair trait Harry got from the Spencer family. Dalton’s memoir unveils unknown aspects of Diana’s life and her relationship with Hewitt.

title: Was it Olivia Nuzzi? Was it Kennedy Jr? Conflicting reports on who made first move
content: Multiple sources revealed to Vanity Fair that Nuzzi and Kennedy went on a hike during the interview in November, last year. Kennedy was an Independent presidential candidate then. He allegedly grabbed Nuzzi's hand. Nuzzi told this to a colleague who too claimed to have a "creepy" encounter with Kennedy Jr before.
summary: Multiple sources revealed to Vanity Fair that Nuzzi and Kennedy went on a hike during the interview in November, last year. Kennedy was an Independent presidential candidate then. He allegedly grabbed Nuzzi's hand. Nuzzi told this to a colleague who too claimed to have a "creepy" encounter with Kennedy Jr before.

title: 'Jesus f**k': Prince Harry at Jimmy Fallon's spooky show; fans say 'the man is American now'
content: Harry's appearance won the hearts of social media users though he was called "potty-mothed", "foul-mouthed" in some news reports. Appearing on Jimmy Fallon show for this fun certified him as an American, an X post said in praise of Harry. "Prince Harry on Jimmy Fallon enjoying some spooky fun. LMAO, that man is American now," it said.

title: Hurricane Helene hits Florida: Residents displaced, streets flooded
Over 30,000 crossed into Syria from Lebanon in past days, says UN
content: Over the past 72 hours, more than 30,000 individuals, primarily Syrians, have crossed into Syria from Lebanon due to an intensifying conflict between Israeli forces and Hezbollah. The UN refugee agency indicates that approximately half of these refugees are children and adolescents. Women are making the crossing in greater numbers compared to men.
summary: Over the past 72 hours, more than 30,000 individuals, primarily Syrians, have crossed into Syria from Lebanon due to an intensifying conflict between Israeli forces and Hezbollah. The UN refugee agency indicates that approximately half of these refugees are children and adolescents. Women are making the crossing in greater numbers compared to men.

title: Landslide in western Indonesia gold mine kills 15, dozens missing
content: A deadly landslide at a gold mine in Western Sumatra, Indonesia, has claimed at least 15 lives and left dozens missing following heavy rainfall. Rescue efforts are ongoing but hindered by the site's remote location. The legality of the mining operation is still undetermined. Unlicensed mines are prevalent in the area.
summary: A deadly landslide at a gold mine in Western Sumatra, Indonesia, has claimed at least 15 lives and left dozens missing following heavy rainfall. Rescue efforts are ongoing but hindered by the site's remote location. The legality of the mining operation is still undetermined. Unlicensed mines are prevalent in the area.

title: Watch: Saturn emerges from behind the Moon in rare video
content: Astrophotographer Andrew McCarthy captured a dramatic video of Saturn emerging from behind the Moon and shared it on social media. Enhanced with an infrared filter for better visibility, the footage shows Saturn's rings as it reappears from the Moon’s shadow. This phenomenon, known as occultation, has intrigued many astronomy enthusiasts and social media users.
summary: Astrophotographer Andrew McCarthy captured a dramatic video of Saturn emerging from behind the Moon and shared it on social media. Enhanced with an infrared filter for better visibility, the footage shows Saturn's rings as it reappears from the Moon’s shadow. This phenomenon, known as occultation, has intrigued many astronomy enthusiasts and social media users.

title: Hurricane Helene weakens to a Category 1 storm
content: Hurricane Helene has downgraded to a Category 1 storm with maximum sustained winds of 75 mph. Initially striking Florida as a Category 4 hurricane, it caused severe flooding and power outages affecting over 885,000 homes and businesses. Now moving northward to Georgia, the storm continues to impact thousands of residents.
summary: Hurricane Helene has downgraded to a Category 1 storm with maximum sustained winds of 75 mph. Initially striking Florida as a Category 4 hurricane, it caused severe flooding and power outages affecting over 885,000 homes and businesses. Now moving northward to Georgia, the storm continues to impact thousands of residents.

title: Earth to get second moon from September 29 to November 25: How to watch
content: Earth is set to gain a temporary mini-moon this autumn with the arrival of asteroid 2024 PT5. The asteroid, measuring about 33 feet wide, will orbit Earth from September 29 to November 25 before leaving its gravitational pull. Professional telescopes will capture images of this rare occurrence, emphasizing the dynamic activity in our solar system.
summary: Earth is set to gain a temporary mini-moon this autumn with the arrival of asteroid 2024 PT5. The asteroid, measuring about 33 feet wide, will orbit Earth from September 29 to November 25 before leaving its gravitational pull. Professional telescopes will capture images of this rare occurrence, emphasizing the dynamic activity in our solar system.

title: Justice or torture: Alabama execute Alan Eugene Miller by Nitrogen hypoxia
content: Alan Eugene Miller was executed in Alabama by nitrogen hypoxia for the 1999 murders of three men. He became the second inmate to die by this method. The execution, which lasted about 15 minutes, was described as going according to plan. This method has been criticized as potentially causing severe suffering.
summary: Alan Eugene Miller was executed in Alabama by nitrogen hypoxia for the 1999 murders of three men. He became the second inmate to die by this method. The execution, which lasted about 15 minutes, was described as going according to plan. This method has been criticized as potentially causing severe suffering.

title: Watch: Haitian President's UN speech goes viral after water pitcher mishap
content: During his UN speech, Haitian President Edgard Leblanc Fils became an internet sensation after spilling water on himself. The incident sparked viral memes but did not overshadow his call for global support to combat gang violence and human rights violations in Haiti. He also demanded reparations for historical injustices and addressed Donald Trump's controversial remarks about Haitian immigrants.
summary: During his UN speech, Haitian President Edgard Leblanc Fils became an internet sensation after spilling water on himself. The incident sparked viral memes but did not overshadow his call for global support to combat gang violence and human rights violations in Haiti. He also demanded reparations for historical injustices and addressed Donald Trump's controversial remarks about Haitian immigrants.

title: Plans underway for bronze sculpture honouring former Victorian premier Daniel Andrews
content: A bronze sculpture is being planned to honour former Victorian premier Daniel Andrews for his over 3000 days in office. This initiative follows a policy from the 1990s aimed at recognising long-serving premiers. The Victorian government has confirmed that planning is underway, with the Department of Premier and Cabinet initiating this process.
summary: A bronze sculpture is being planned to honour former Victorian premier Daniel Andrews for his over 3000 days in office. This initiative follows a policy from the 1990s aimed at recognising long-serving premiers. The Victorian government has confirmed that planning is underway, with the Department of Premier and Cabinet initiating this process.

title: Shigeru Ishiba to become Japan's next prime minister
content: Shigeru Ishiba won the Liberal Democratic Party leadership election with 215 votes and is set to become Japan's next prime minister. Defeating Sanae Takaichi who secured 194 votes, Ishiba emphasizes his experience in tackling social issues. The LDP has governed Japan nearly uninterrupted for decades, often overshadowing opposition parties.
summary: Shigeru Ishiba won the Liberal Democratic Party leadership election with 215 votes and is set to become Japan's next prime minister. Defeating Sanae Takaichi who secured 194 votes, Ishiba emphasizes his experience in tackling social issues. The LDP has governed Japan nearly uninterrupted for decades, often overshadowing opposition parties.

title: Boris Johnson gave 'manly pep talk' to Harry in bid to stop 'Megxit', memoir reveals
content: In his memoir 'Unleashed,' former UK PM Boris Johnson recounts his attempt to persuade Prince Harry to stay in his royal role through a 'manly pep talk' in 2020. Despite commending Harry and Meghan's contributions, Johnson found the effort futile as Harry was determined to step back from royal duties.
summary: In his memoir 'Unleashed,' former UK PM Boris Johnson recounts his attempt to persuade Prince Harry to stay in his royal role through a 'manly pep talk' in 2020. Despite commending Harry and Meghan's contributions, Johnson found the effort futile as Harry was determined to step back from royal duties.

title: From Ellen DeGeneres to the Kardashians: What celebrities have said about Sean Diddy’s wild parties
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs has been arrested on charges of sex trafficking, racketeering, and prostitution. Authorities allege that his infamous parties were multi-day events involving drugs, alcohol, and forced sexual acts. Celebrities like Ashton Kutcher and Khloé Kardashian have shared their experiences at these gatherings. Diddy has pleaded not guilty to the charges.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs has been arrested on charges of sex trafficking, racketeering, and prostitution. Authorities allege that his infamous parties were multi-day events involving drugs, alcohol, and forced sexual acts. Celebrities like Ashton Kutcher and Khloé Kardashian have shared their experiences at these gatherings. Diddy has pleaded not guilty to the charges.

title: Countries with the highest Indian population including Mauritius, UK, Canada, and more
content: The Indian diaspora is a vibrant global community influencing various countries' cultural and economic landscapes. Key nations with substantial Indian populations include Mauritius, the United States, the UAE, Malaysia, Saudi Arabia, Myanmar, Canada, the UK, South Africa, and Singapore. The article details their contributions and celebrates their unique stories across these regions.

The article details their contributions and celebrates their unique stories across these regions.

title: Vice-presidential debate between Walz and Vance: When and where to watch
content: Minnesota governor Tim Walz and Ohio senator JD Vance will face off in their only vice presidential debate on October 1. Moderated by Norah O'Donnell and Margaret Brennan, the event takes place in New York City and airs live on CBS News platforms. Both candidates are intensively preparing for this pivotal debate.
summary: Minnesota governor Tim Walz and Ohio senator JD Vance will face off in their only vice presidential debate on October 1. Moderated by Norah O'Donnell and Margaret Brennan, the event takes place in New York City and airs live on CBS News platforms. Both candidates are intensively preparing for this pivotal debate.
